statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Georgia Tech 86, Pepperdine 58
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. -- Alade Aminu had team highs of 18 points and 11 rebounds to lead Georgia Tech to an 86-58 victory over Pepperdine Saturday. The Yellow Jackets, playing just their second road game of the season and their first outside the state of Georgia, improved to 7-2. The Waves (1-11) lost their 11th straight game since a season-opening win against Cal State Monterey Bay. Aminu led six Georgia Tech players that scored in double-figures, including all five starters. Iman Shumpert had 15 points, seven assists and three steals. Gani Lawal had his ACC-leading sixth double-double of the season with 11 points and 10 rebounds. Mychel Thompson was Pepperdine's only player to reach double-figures, scoring a game-high of 20 points. It was his second-highest total of the season and the third time that the sophomore has reached the 20-point plateau in his career. Georgia Tech outshot the Waves 54.8 percent to 36.2 percent. The Yellow Jackets forced 20 turnovers and turned that into a 34-12 edge in points off turnovers. Pepperdine took an 8-2 lead at the first timeout as Thompson made a pair of three-pointers, but Aminu had seven points as Georgia Tech went on a 15-3 run over the next 4 1/2 minutes to grab a 17-11 lead. Shumpert later hit two three-pointers during an 8-0 run that increased the Yellow Jackets' lead to 29-16 with 6 1/2 minutes remaining in the first half. Georgia Tech went into the break with a 40-26 advantage. This was the second meeting between the two schools. The first was a Yellow Jacket neutral-site victory in December 1983. Georgia Tech stays in the area to play at Southern California on Monday, while Pepperdine is next at the Rainbow Classic in Hawaii on Dec. 28-30. The Waves' first game is against Buffalo.
